articles.headline: Long an Uneasy Prince, King Charles III Takes On a Role He Was Born To
articles.snippet: Once an awkward, self-doubting young man, he comes to the throne, at 73, as a self-assured, gray-haired eminence.
articles.abstract: Once an awkward, self-doubting young man, he comes to the throne, at 73, as a self-assured, gray-haired eminence.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Never, perhaps, has an heir been more ready for the crown.

articles.headline: The Queen’s Death Comes at a Moment of Great Uncertainty for Britain
articles.snippet: There is no analogous British figure who will be mourned as deeply, or whose death will provoke a greater reckoning with the identity and future of the country.
articles.abstract: There is no analogous British figure who will be mourned as deeply, or whose death will provoke a greater reckoning with the identity and future of the country.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Queen Elizabeth II, whose seven-decade reign made her the only sovereign that most Britons had ever known, died on Thursday at her summer estate in Scotland, thrusting a bereaved country into a momentous transition at a time of political and economic upheaval.

articles.headline: After a Legal Fight, Oberlin Says It Will Pay $36.59 Million to a Local Bakery
articles.snippet: Gibson’s Bakery said the liberal arts college had falsely accused it of racism after a Black student was caught shoplifting.
articles.abstract: Gibson’s Bakery said the liberal arts college had falsely accused it of racism after a Black student was caught shoplifting.
articles.lead_paragraph: Oberlin College, known as a bastion of progressive politics, said on Thursday that it would pay $36.59 million to a local bakery that said it had been defamed and falsely accused of racism after a worker caught a Black student shoplifting.

articles.headline: China’s Public Puts on a Show of Zero Covid for an Audience of One
articles.snippet: Because of Xi Jinping’s unrelenting policy, the Chinese people put up with a precarious existence filled with lockdowns, quarantines and mass testing.
articles.abstract: Because of Xi Jinping’s unrelenting policy, the Chinese people put up with a precarious existence filled with lockdowns, quarantines and mass testing.
articles.lead_paragraph: As fire was raging in the mountains surrounding the southwestern Chinese metropolis of Chongqing, 10 million residents stood in 100-plus-degree heat to get Covid tests. Two cases were detected that day in August.

articles.headline: How Do Japanese Show They Care? By Sending a Telegram.
articles.snippet: Millions of the messages still crisscross Japan each year, offering congratulations or condolences in a way that more modern communications cannot.
articles.abstract: Millions of the messages still crisscross Japan each year, offering congratulations or condolences in a way that more modern communications cannot.
articles.lead_paragraph: TOKYO — When he got married this summer, Hiroshi Kanno, who works at a security services firm in Tokyo, wanted to make a big statement that would impress his future in-laws.
articles.byline: By Ben Dooley and Hikari Hida
